blocks.heading: Try Terraform Cloud
blocks.subheading: Sign up for Terraform cloud for free and start managing infrastructure with your team.

collectionCards.description: Build, change, and destroy AWS infrastructure using Terraform. Step-by-step, command-line tutorials will walk you through the Terraform basics for the first time.
collectionCards.heading: Get Started - AWS

collectionCards.description: Build, change, and destroy Azure infrastructure using Terraform. Step-by-step, command-line tutorials will walk you through the Terraform basics for the first time.
collectionCards.heading: Get Started - Azure

collectionCards.description: Collaborate on version-controlled configuration using Terraform Cloud. Follow this track to build, change, and destroy infrastructure using remote runs and state.
collectionCards.heading: Get Started - Terraform Cloud

collectionCards.description: Build, change, and destroy Docker infrastructure using Terraform. Step-by-step, command-line tutorials will walk you through the Terraform basics for the first time.
collectionCards.heading: Get Started - Docker

collectionCards.description: Build, change, and destroy Google Cloud Platform (GCP) infrastructure using Terraform. Step-by-step, command-line tutorials will walk you through the Terraform basics for the first time.
collectionCards.heading: Get Started - Google Cloud

collectionCards.description: Build, change, and destroy a virtual cloud network and subnet on Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) using Terraform. Step-by-step, command-line tutorials will walk you through the Terraform basics for the first time.
collectionCards.heading: Get Started - OCI

blocks.heading: Get Started
blocks.subheading: Build, change, and destroy infrastructure with Terraform. Start here to learn the basics of Terraform with your favorite cloud provider.

blocks.heading: New Tutorials
blocks.subheading: Try the newest tutorials for common Terraform tasks and use cases.

tutorialCards.description: Manage dynamic credentials with a Terraform Cloud project. Create trust relationships for a single workspace, an entire project, and provision infrastructure with a no-code module.
tutorialCards.heading: Enable Self-Service Workflows with Vault-Backed Dynamic Credentials

tutorialCards.description: Enable and use Terraform Cloud health assessments to detect infrastructure changes outside the Terraform workflow.
tutorialCards.heading: Use Health Assessments to Detect Infrastructure Drift

tutorialCards.description: Use the Confluent provider to create Apache Kafka clusters, topics, and service accounts using Terraform.
tutorialCards.heading: Manage Hosted Apache Kafka with the Confluent Terraform Provider

tutorialCards.description: Use Terraform Cloud to enforce OPA policies and detect infrastructure configuration drift.
tutorialCards.heading: Detect Infrastructure Drift and Enforce OPA Policies

tutorialCards.description: Use Terraform Cloud no-code modules to let users provision resources without writing Terraform configuration.
tutorialCards.heading: Create and Use No-Code Modules

tutorialCards.description: Refactor a local module to organize related attributes with objects and make some attributes optional for module users.
tutorialCards.heading: Customize Modules with Object Attributes

blocks.heading: Get Certified
blocks.subheading: Prepare for Associate Certification with our prep materials, or follow tutorials that cover most of the major topics covered in the exam.

collectionCards.description: Prepare for the HashiCorp Certified: Terraform Associate exam. These guides list the test objectives for the exam and the complete list of docs and tutorials to study.
collectionCards.heading: Prepare for Terraform Certification

collectionCards.description: Study for the Terraform Associate exam by following these tutorials. Login to Learn and bookmark them to track your progress. Study the complete list of study materials (including docs) in the Certification Prep guides.
collectionCards.heading: Associate Tutorial List

blocks.heading: Build Providers
blocks.subheading: Use the Terraform Plugin Framework to build providers that use common Go conventions.

collectionCards.description: In these tutorials, learn how Terraform uses providers to interact with target APIs. Then, build a custom provider based on the new Terraform Plugin Framework.
collectionCards.heading: Call APIs with Custom Framework Providers
